item.title: Euromonitor has discovered that India and China have lower-than-average per capita calorie purchases
item.description:
A new study by Euromonitor International reveals how many nutrients people consume daily from packaged foods and beverages. This data, found in their Passport: Nutrition database, tracks the consumption of calories, fats, saturated fats, carbohydrates, sugars, salt, protein, and fiber across 54 countries. Globally, we buy enough packaged food and soft drinks to consume 1.5 trillion calories per day, averaging 765 calories per person. While a healthy daily intake is around 2,000 calories, North America and Western Europe exceed 1,500 calories, contrasting with India’s 150 and China’s 510...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/euromonitor-has-discovered-that-india-and-china-have-lower-than-average-per-capita-calorie-purchases/

item.title: Asia is leading in the Henley Passport Index
item.description:
Asian nations are leading the Henley Passport Index, a ranking of all passports based on how many destinations their holders can visit without a pre-arranged visa. This index uses exclusive data from the International Air Transport Association (IATA). For the third year in a row, Japan holds the top spot with a visa-free/visa-on-arrival score of 191, meaning Japanese citizens can travel to 191 destinations without needing a visa beforehand. Singapore holds second place, while South Korea ties with Germany for third place...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/asia-is-leading-in-the-henley-passport-index/
